metadata.title: CVE-2023-4921 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - high
metadata.description:
A use-after-free vulnerability in the Linux kernel's net/sched: sch_qfqcomponent can be exploited to achieve local privilege escalation. When theplug qdisc is used as a class of the qfq qdisc, sending network packetstriggers use-after-free in qfq_dequeue() due to the incorrect .peek handlerof sch_plug and lack of error checking in agg_dequeue(). We recommendupgrading past commit 8fc134fee27f2263988ae38920bc03da416b03d8.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-4921` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic-64k - 6.8.0-31.31
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-aws - 6.8.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-azure - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-gcp - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency - 6.8.0-31.31.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-31.31.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle - 6.8.0-1005.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle-64k - 6.8.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1004-raspi - 6.8.0-1004.4
No subscription required
